snippet: Gov. Andrew Cuomo deserves credit for stepping forward to protect 69,000 acres of timberland in the Adirondacks from commercial development.
abstract: Editorial praises New York Gov Andrew Cuomo for purchasing 69,000 acres of Adirondack timberland from the Nature Conservancy, thereby protecting the land from commercial development; holds Cuomo still must address rules and regulations of the Adirondacks Park Agency, which badly need updating.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew Cuomo deserves credit for stepping forward to protect 69,000 acres of timberland in the Adirondacks from commercial development.
